result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany Ann Klobertanz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brittany Ann Klobertanz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brittany Ann Klobertanz was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must follow rules of supervision.
Concurrent with: 14CF460 & 16CF82

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Bond to be applied with any remaining balance to be paid within 60 days or set up payment plan.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
Must complete a Mental Health Assessment & comply with recommendations.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.
If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
No contact with Brice Wallace or Brandon Nickell.
No illegal substances.

Must reside at the Butterfly House & comply with program.
Must provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
